previewArticle.title: New England Revolution vs. New York Red Bulls | MLS Cup Playoffs Match Preview

recapArticle.title: New England Revolution 2, New York Red Bulls 2 | MLS Cup Playoffs Match Recap

timelineItems.desc: The National Anthem is sung before the Eastern Conference Championship at Gillette Stadium.
timelineItems.title: Easten Conference Championship National Anthem

timelineItems.desc: The Red Bulls and Revolution are underway at Gillette Stadium
timelineItems.title: KICKOFF: New England Revolution vs. New York Red Bulls

timelineItems.desc: An excited Rev's team celebrate winning the Eastern Conference Championship.
timelineItems.title: TROPHY PRESENTATION: The New England Revolution are awarded the Eastern Conference Championship Trophy

timelineItems.desc: Attempt saved. Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the bottom right corner.
timelineItems.title: SHOT: Teal Bunbury squirts an early shot in on goal

timelineItems.comment: First Half begins.
Attempt saved. Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the bottom right corner. Assisted by Andrew Farrell.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: We are underway at Gillette Stadium. Going with a 2-2 draw here. #RBNY #NERevs #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: T.S. Bagley
timelineItems.text: Hate to say it but New York is sounding loud today. Time for the #NERevs @NErebellion @MidnightRiders and all the fans to make some noise

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: First one on frame by the Red Bulls comes off the foot of Henry. Easy save for Shuttleworth. Both teams creating chances early #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Tim Cahill (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the right side of the box is just a bit too high. Assisted by Richard Eckersley.

timelineItems.name: Martin Siry
timelineItems.text: That was shades of the World Cup right there by Cahill #RBNY

timelineItems.desc: Bobby Shuttleworth pokes away the cross by Thierry Henry.
timelineItems.title: CROSS: Bobby Shuttleworth makes a great punch out on a cross by Henry

timelineItems.comment: Kevin Alston (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Julian Cardillo
timelineItems.text: Great keeping by Bobby Shuttleworth there. Wow. But terrific move by Henry to keep play alive. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Liam O'Murchu
timelineItems.text: Bobby Shuttleworth ladies and gentlemen. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Austin Fido
timelineItems.text: Dammit. Attack the ball, Timmy. #RBNY #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Paul Kennedy
timelineItems.text: Great work so far by Luyindula, Sam & Henry for #RBNY to create openings. #NERevs are playing with fire.

timelineItems.name: Joe Tansey
timelineItems.text: Henry outmuscled Farrell with ease there. Watch that matchup for the rest of match. Farrell may require help if that continues. #NEvNY

timelineItems.desc:
This weekend's 2nd leg of the Eastern Conference Championship has been over a year in the making for the New England Revolution and New York Red Bulls. Both teams are looking to redeem heartbreaking losses in the 2013 MLS Cup Playoffs and book a ticket to the 2014 MLS Cup.

For more coverage of the 2014 MLS Cup Playoffs, presented by AT&T visit: http://www.mlssoccer.com/mlscup/2014
timelineItems.title: NE vs. NY: It all comes down to this | MLS Cup Playoffs presented by AT&T

timelineItems.comment: Offside, New England Revolution. Jermaine Jones tries a through ball, but Teal Bunbury is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Ryan Brown
timelineItems.text: Anyone else look at Alston's hair and immediately think of Radagast the Brown from the Hobbit film? #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jámison Olave (New York Red Bulls).
Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Another great feed from Jones, this time to Davies but Alexander comes back to make a good defensive play for NY #NERevs

timelineItems.name: MLSApologist
timelineItems.text: What if artificial turf is secretly Thierry Henry's speciality, and this is the big payoff of the long con? #NEvNY #TinFoilHat

timelineItems.comment: Match ends, New England Revolution 2, New York Red Bulls 2.

timelineItems.name: George E Dailey III
timelineItems.text: #NERevs Charlie Davies is such an inspiration. He's the Bloody Sock of soccer!

timelineItems.desc: After a rough-and-tumble first leg of the Eastern Conference Championship, the second leg shifts to Gillette Stadium for the deciding game as the Red Bulls and Revolution battle for a spot in the 2014 MLS Cup.
timelineItems.title: HIGHLIGHTS: New England Revolution vs. New York Red Bulls | November 29, 2014

timelineItems.desc:
MLSsoccer.com's Andrew Wiebe catches up with New England Revolution owners Robert and Jonathan Kraft after Saturday night's match against the New York Red Bulls that saw the Revolution advance to MLS Cup.

For more coverage of the 2014 MLS Cup Playoffs, presented by AT&T visit: http://www.mlssoccer.com/mlscup/2014
timelineItems.title: NE Revolution owners Robert and Jonathan Kraft share their thoughts on advancing to MLS Cup | MLS Cup Playoffs presented by AT&T

timelineItems.desc:
Former MLS player and coach Jesse Marsch breaks down New England's key players in their 2-2 second leg draw with the New York Red Bulls. The Revolution advance to MLS Cup 4-3 on aggregate.

For more coverage of the 2014 MLS Cup Playoffs, presented by AT&T visit: http://www.mlssoccer.com/mlscup/2014
timelineItems.title: Jesse Marsch on New England's short corner & key cross in leg 2 vs. New York | 2014 MLS Cup Playoffs

timelineItems.desc:
MLSsoccer.com's Andrew Wiebe gets post-game reaction from Gillette Stadium following the New England Revolution's 2-2 draw with the New York Red Bulls. New England advances to MLS Cup 4-3 on aggregate.

For more coverage of the 2014 MLS Cup Playoffs, presented by AT&T visit: http://www.mlssoccer.com/mlscup/2014
timelineItems.title: New England Revolution vs. New York Red Bulls post-game reaction from Gillette Stadium | 2014 MLS Cup Playoffs

timelineItems.desc: MLSsoccer.com’s Jason Saghini and Greg Lalas recap Leg 2 of the Eastern Conference Championship, with post game interviews from Charlie Davies, Lee Nguyen, and Jermaine Jones.
timelineItems.title: NE Revolution vs. NY Red Bulls Leg 2 Recap | MLS Cup Playoffs presented by AT&T

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: Jones doing plenty of playmaking from his spot, but he is operating much deeper than he was in the first leg. #NERevs #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Metrohooligan101
timelineItems.text: Oyongo losing that left side battle. Midfield looks sparse. Need more cohesion. Already missed a couple chances. #RBNY

timelineItems.comment: Hand ball by Kevin Alston (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: Mike Gray
timelineItems.text: Pro/rel activists, turn off the TV right now. This isn't what you want, apparently. #NEvNY #MLS

timelineItems.name: Ian Lynch
timelineItems.text: Guard your wallets #RBNY Jones will pick your pocket and laugh as he hands it back #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Ben Ashton
timelineItems.text: Great ball in to the box by Henry causes some confusion but New England scramble it clear! #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Davies looking for a foul in the box but it was a really good defensive effort from NY #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Carl Setterlund
timelineItems.text: Charlie Davies really impressive right there showing off the afterburners, but he went down a bit too easy in the box #NERevs #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Henry winning 1-on-1 against Farrell in the defensive corner makes me smile. #RBNY #NERevs

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) left footed shot from outside the box misses to the right.
timelineItems.title: SHOT: Jermaine Jones fires a shot from distance wide

timelineItems.name: #YESvember
timelineItems.text: The home run pass is not working today #RBNY

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New England Revolution 0, New York Red Bulls 1. Tim Cahill (New York Red Bulls) left footed shot from the center of the box.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Tim Cahill pokes in the opening goal

timelineItems.name: Hayden Bird
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones rips a left-footed shot, but it’s wide. #NERevs seem content to let the game come to them, but that’s clearly not their style

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) left footed shot from outside the box misses to the right. Assisted by Teal Bunbury.

timelineItems.name: Kevin Dorn
timelineItems.text: Halfway there TIMMY CAHILL massive goal #RBNY still breathing

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: My word. Cahill poked it home THROUGH Goncalves’ legs. Super nutmeg goal. #RBNY #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Swell finish from Mr. @Tim_Cahill. 1-0 @NewYorkRedBulls. Huge. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Nick Chávez
timelineItems.text: CAHIIIIIIILLL! HELL OF A BALL FROM HENRY!!! #RBNY #NERevs #MLS

timelineItems.desc: Attempt blocked. Andrew Farrell (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the right side of the box is blocked.
timelineItems.title: BLOCK: Andrew Farrell's shot is knocked away

timelineItems.name: Simon Borg
timelineItems.text: Cahill kissed armband after scoring RT @RussSargeant: . @Tim_Cahill wearing black armband to honor Phillip Hughes.#RIPPhillipHughes #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Richard Eckersley.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt blocked. Chris Tierney (New England Revolution) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked.
timelineItems.title: BLOCK: Chris Tierney has a long distance shot poked away

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Andrew Farrell (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the right side of the box is blocked. Assisted by Jermaine Jones.
Attempt blocked. Chris Tierney (New England Revolution) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked. Assisted by Lee Nguyen with a cross.
Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Dax McCarty.

timelineItems.name: MLSApologist
timelineItems.text: Has a team ever succeeded when abandoning the style that got them there in the first place? #NERevs needs to get back to their style, ASAP.

timelineItems.name: Eric Giacometti
timelineItems.text: Looking back, that was some pass from Henry... was facing away from net and still put it on a platter... wow #RBNY #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: German Castro
timelineItems.text: This game is about to get crazy. #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.name: Kevin Koczwara
timelineItems.text: #NERevs getting down the right early. Bunbury finding space and time.

timelineItems.name: Emily
timelineItems.text: #PetkesSweater is on point today👔👌 #MLSPlayoffs #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Fútbol MLS
timelineItems.text: La perfección es decisiva. Henry para Cahill y la serie se ha abierto: http://t.co/3TsXN6ZfrU #NEvNY http://t.co/9Xdt4uDSdu

timelineItems.name: Dave Martinez
timelineItems.text: Cahill a pressure player. Doesn't shy from spotlight, which certainly turned his direction this week. Tremendous goal #RBNY #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Not to pee in RBNY's cheerios, but this exact scenario is why it was so insane of Petke to go for it at 1-1 in the first leg. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: KICKTV
timelineItems.text: Dramatic re-enactment of @Tim_Cahill's goal for the @NewYorkRedBulls. #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs http://t.co/V3RRwBsQfi

timelineItems.name: Christopher
timelineItems.text: New England wanted a handball for Alexander trying not to die. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Hand ball by Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: NESoccerToday.com
timelineItems.text: #NERevs with 51% possession thus far, but #RBNY had 64.3% possession in the five minutes preceeding their goal. #NYvNE #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.name: Nick Chávez
timelineItems.text: Henry spraying quality balls into #NERevs box from all over the pitch. If he's going out, he's going out with a bang today. #RBNY #Henry

timelineItems.name: Chris Ravita
timelineItems.text: Whatever the end result, #RBNY came into this second leg super prepared. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Foul by A.J. Soares (New England Revolution).
Tim Cahill (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick on the left wing.

timelineItems.name: Go, Titletown!
timelineItems.text: Bobby Shuttleworth looking like he's made some changes since Cahill goal. Much more aggressive on last shot. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New York Red Bulls. Conceded by José Gonçalves.

timelineItems.name: Ryan Brister
timelineItems.text: #NERevs looking shaky at the back.

timelineItems.name: Paul Kennedy
timelineItems.text: Taking lead back home looks like worst thing that could have happened to #NERevs. Playing cautiously with lots of nerves. #NYvNE

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Tim Cahill (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the centre of the box is blocked.
Attempt missed. Jámison Olave (New York Red Bulls) header from the centre of the box is too high. Assisted by Tim Cahill following a corner.

timelineItems.name: Alan's Magic 8-Ball
timelineItems.text: Titi just gave Oyongo the stare of death #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Eric Giacometti
timelineItems.text: Stating the obvious here, but #RBNY would do well to notch the 2nd before #NERevs can regroup at halftime #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Juan Escalante
timelineItems.text: Titi stares into your soul and makes you question your place in the universe. #RBNY #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Andy Brown
timelineItems.text: Let's go revs!! #NERevs #STAND #Itstoocold

timelineItems.name: MassiveCity
timelineItems.text: As humans, we should all give thanks on this Thanksgiving weekend that Bobby Shuttlesworth has survived these 38 minutes of #NEvNY.

timelineItems.desc: New York Red Bulls cross from Lloyd Sam is deflected away.
timelineItems.title: CROSS: Llyod Sam sends in a good ball for Thierry Henry

timelineItems.name: Julian Cardillo
timelineItems.text: Fast paced start to this game! wooooooo #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Charlie Davies (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New England Revolution 1, New York Red Bulls 1. Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) header from very close range.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Charlie Davies knocks in the equalizer for the Revs

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  New England Revolution. Conceded by Jámison Olave.

timelineItems.name: Leanne Elston
timelineItems.text: Pretty sure Davies is just wearing one of Nguyen's headbands around his neck. #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.name: Brian Little
timelineItems.text: CHARLIE DAVIES GOAL #NEREVS

timelineItems.name: Aria A.
timelineItems.text: #NERevs GOLAAZOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: Tie game, as Davies scrambles it home on a corner. #RBNY #NERevs

timelineItems.text: Short corner + Charlie Davies = 1-1: http://t.co/N4klHDKtEX #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Chris Tierney (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. A.J. Soares (New England Revolution) header from the center of the box is too high.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: A.J. Soares pops a header high over the bar

timelineItems.name: Austin Fido
timelineItems.text: Irrelevant. Get another and see where we stand, #RBNY. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. A.J. Soares (New England Revolution) header from the centre of the box is too high. Assisted by Chris Tierney with a cross following a set piece situation.
Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the left wing.
Foul by Jámison Olave (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: WrongSideOfThePond
timelineItems.text: Honestly, that goal doesn't change too much for #RBNY: they still needed a second goal regardless. Now it just won't be a winner. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Charles Boehm
timelineItems.text: Even on turf, Charlie Davies is an ace mudder. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: John Fischer
timelineItems.text: Woah. Olave, your mouth. #rbny

timelineItems.name: Dave Martinez
timelineItems.text: Cahill said at training this week #RBNY practically anticipated conceding one. Can still push game to OT with a 2-1 result. Not impossible.

timelineItems.comment: First Half ends, New England Revolution 1, New York Red Bulls 1.

timelineItems.name: Franco Panizo
timelineItems.text: HT. #NERevs 1, #RBNY 1. Red Bulls go up through Cahill, but concede to Davies. New York finding attacking success. More goals in this one.

timelineItems.name: Thomas Floyd
timelineItems.text: Mike Petke: "Oyongo needs to wake up on the left." Well put. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Fútbol MLS
timelineItems.text: Con un gol tardío de Charlie Davies, @NERevolution vuelve a tomar ventaja en la serie: http://t.co/cxg697Ki2i #NEvNY http://t.co/M19RiH9QLM

timelineItems.name: Andrew Wiebe
timelineItems.text: Tough goal to give up, but doesn't change too much for New York. Need a goal to equalize instead of pull ahead. Opp is there. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Michael Demko
timelineItems.text: I love @petkemike ... Such a boss #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer

Nguyen this. 
#NERevs #STAND #BlessTheRains

timelineItems.text: Go Revs! It's cold but a blast! #NERevs http://t.co/i0ygk7ygKz

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) left footed shot from the centre of the box misses to the left.
Lineups are announced and players are warming up.

timelineItems.name: Richard Jaffa
timelineItems.text: Uncharacteristically poor decision making from Jermaine Jones there, he simply had to feed Davies the ball but opted to go alone. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the centre of the box is close, but misses to the right. Assisted by Lee Nguyen.

timelineItems.name: Fútbol MLS
timelineItems.text: 2-1 en contra y ahora como visitantes. ¿Podrán los Red Bulls remontar? En media hora: http://t.co/SiL74XzmuY #NEvNY http://t.co/cH69vssyuy

timelineItems.name: Jeni Arsenal
timelineItems.text: Thierry Henry (potentially) ending his career on turf. Bet when he was a kid he never thought that would happen! #RBNY #afc

timelineItems.name: Carl Setterlund
timelineItems.text: IMO Chris Tierney's left wing service in to Davies/Bunbury/Nguyen could prove just as useful to #NERevs as Rowe's scoring prowess #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Tim Cahill (New York Red Bulls).
Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Samantha E.
timelineItems.text: Revs putting on the pressure the first few minutes of this half. Step it up #RBNY!

timelineItems.comment: Offside, New England Revolution. Lee Nguyen tries a through ball, but Teal Bunbury is caught offside.

Foul by Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: Boston 2024

New England Revolution game.

timelineItems.name: Sandra Lazo
timelineItems.text: This game is going to be a nail-biter. #NEvNY

timelineItems.text: Pregame photo: @JermaineJunior stretches as @NERevolution fans stream into Gillette. Expecting 30k+ today #NEvNY http://t.co/x4x4L4uWgz

timelineItems.name: mattyjollie
timelineItems.text: One game away. 90 minutes. #STAND #NERevs

timelineItems.text: Kevin Alston provides the #NERevs with speed down the left flank in defending Lloyd Sam. #RBNY #NEvNY

timelineItems.text: REALLLLLLY hope this isn't Henry's last game. #NYRB

timelineItems.name: Ainslie Binder
timelineItems.text: “@mcsfantos: @ainslieann We're ready! #RBNYvRevs #RBNY #MLSPlayoffs #WeWantTheCup http://t.co/VE7gId2k3M” ⚽️⚽️⚽️👍👍👍

timelineItems.name: Brian E. Long⭐
timelineItems.text: PEGUYYYYYYYY!!!!!!! #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Leanne Elston
timelineItems.text: No STAHP. #MLSPlayoffs #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Dan Dickinson
timelineItems.text: GOAL PEGUY! The away goals are NO LONGER IN NEW ENGLANDS FAVOR. #RBNY #NERevs

timelineItems.name: John Fischer
timelineItems.text: Ok. Over the bar. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Goal. Red Bulls knot it up again. Luyindula finds the back of the net and we are level 3-3 on aggregate. No more away goal advantage #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Saer's right foot
timelineItems.text: Bob Kraft must've found that revs gear in someone else's box. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Mitchell R. Beck
timelineItems.text: @Tim_Cahill No doubt that this is the moment the #NYRB brought you in for. Today you make Red Bulls history. Let's go Red Bulls.

timelineItems.name: Scott Shields
timelineItems.text: Whatever happens today, this has actually been a pretty great season. That said, let's get this, #RBNY. I want to go to my first MLS Cup.

timelineItems.name: the names Rescue
timelineItems.text: Yea I'm from New England but I can't rock with the revs. Too many fair weather fans. So yall know who supportin #NYRB

timelineItems.name: ficklish
timelineItems.text: Game time!! #nerevolution #boston #soccer

timelineItems.name: ExtraTime Radio
timelineItems.text: Stadium starting to fill up. Players are off the field. Will the @NERevolution hold on or can @NewYorkRedBulls pull off the surprise #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Neil Scott
timelineItems.text: Would love to see Henry and New York win this game and the series, but I'm expecting The Revs to make it through. #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.name: Andrew Wiebe
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones exited the field with a handshake from Robert Kraft. They pay him the big bucks for the big moments. Will JJ deliver? #NEvNY

timelineItems.text: Time for Lee Nguyen to wake up and show us why he is the MVP. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Austin Fido
timelineItems.text: Oyongo's AFCON chances are receding in this game. Pick it up, sir. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the right side of the box is saved in the centre of the goal. Assisted by Péguy Luyindula.

timelineItems.name: Go, Titletown!
timelineItems.text: Revolution. Should. Have. Scored. Blatant positional miscue in the box leads to goalless chance for New England. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: James Ruth
timelineItems.text: #Nerves #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Alexandria Seaborne
timelineItems.text: This game is already more exciting than the liverpool game. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Briannna Shinner
timelineItems.text: Shalrie Joseph just walked by me nonchalantly 🙈💁 lol #NERevs

timelineItems.name: ChicagoFireOpinion
timelineItems.text: Good soccer being played by both teams so far #NYRBvNE #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the right wing.
Foul by Dax McCarty (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: John Fischer
timelineItems.text: Forget the motion! He got the ball! #RBNY

timelineItems.name: John
timelineItems.text: Good on you @DaxMcCarty11!!! Worth the yellow! #RBNY #MLS

timelineItems.name: Rob Ditta
timelineItems.text: Hah! Dax McCarty and Jermaine Jones should BOTH have been sent off. Consistency is key I guess...consistently wrong that is. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Ambroise Oyongo (New York Red Bulls).
Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Matt
timelineItems.text: That's it, keep em in line Thierry #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Rob Parritt
timelineItems.text: Henry showing leadership for NYRB, who's going to step up for the Revs? #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Tim Cahill (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by A.J. Soares (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: John Fischer
timelineItems.text: Nguyen apparently is made of balsa wood. You can't run into the Boss!! #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Ben Ashton
timelineItems.text: Lee Nguyen collides with Olave and was looking for a penalty but the ref isn't interested #NEvNY #NERevs #RBNY

timelineItems.name: The Indie Handbook
timelineItems.text: Forget Landycakes, MLS will be a poorer place without Henry. #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Tim Cahill (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from the centre of the box is too high. Assisted by Thierry Henry with a cross.

timelineItems.name: Andrew Wiebe
timelineItems.text: Somewhere near Columbus, Ohio, Gregg Berhalter is doubling down on the embellishment claims. Good no-call there from Toledo IMO. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Brian
timelineItems.text: DAMMIT CAHILL! Sheesh. What a ball by Henry there. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Alexander Abnos
timelineItems.text: BREAKING NEWS: This is a good soccer game. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the right wing.
Foul by Ambroise Oyongo (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Brian E. Long⭐
timelineItems.text: Heart pounding. About to pass out. Shouldn't have had all that coffee. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Andrew Wiebe
timelineItems.text: After seeing replay, clear Olave got a stomp. Terrible from the big man. FWIW, not saying MVLee dove. Just saying not a PK for me. #NEvNY

timelineItems.comment: Kevin Alston (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Lloyd Sam (New York Red Bulls).
Offside, New England Revolution. José Gonçalves tries a through ball, but Charlie Davies is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Brian E. Long⭐
timelineItems.text: Get ready...Henry's about to step it up. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Alex Chang
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones need to appear on Inside the Actors Studio. #NEvNY

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  New England Revolution 2, New York Red Bulls 2. Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) header from the center of the box.

timelineItems.comment: Delay in match Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) because of an injury.

timelineItems.name: Austin Fido
timelineItems.text: Ach...Peguy...How. Did. He. Miss. #NEvNY

timelineItems.name: Andrew Wiebe
timelineItems.text: And what did we say about Lloyd Sam? Inches away from a massive opener. At some point, he'll have to go for his own shot as well. #NEvNY

timelineItems.text: Charlie Davies empata el partido y por ahora los mete en la final. Partidazo. Punto: http://t.co/8x1wUFWZ51 #NEvNY http://t.co/ZdbVFAtkR8

timelineItems.name: Jimmy Nelson
timelineItems.text: Wow. That was close. Great read from Shuttleworth. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Joe Prince-Wright
timelineItems.text: Stage set perfectly for Henry to be the hero. Red Bulls need one goal to make it to MLS Cup final. Just one... #NEvNY #MLS

timelineItems.name: matt.gebhart
timelineItems.text: I'm not even a fan of either team and I'm on the edge of my seat. I'm a fan of good soccer and this game is delivering. #NEvNY #MLSPlayoffs

timelineItems.desc: FIFA 15 picks the winner of leg 2 of the Eastern Conference Championship between the New York Red Bulls and New England Revolution at Gillette Stadium.

timelineItems.desc: Katie Witham and Jesse Marsch discuss and analyze the lead stories, in addition to what adjustments both teams need to make, for this Saturday's Eastern Conference Championship clash between the New England Revolution and New York Red Bulls.
